item.title: Matrix rebrands India, China units for ‘organizational independence’
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Matrix is rebranding its India and China affiliates, becoming the latest venture firm to distance its international franchises. The U.S.-headquartered venture capital firm will retain its name, while Matrix Partners India will rebrand to Z47 and Matrix Partners China will rename itself MPC. Matrix began operating the India affiliated fund in 2006 and the China […]

item.title: Amazon hires founders away from AI startup Adept
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Adept, a startup developing AI-powered “agents” to complete various software-based tasks, has agreed to license its tech to Amazon and the startup’s co-founders and portions of its team have joined the ecommerce giant. Geekwire’s Taylor Soper first reported the news. According to Soper, Adept co-founder and CEO David Luan will join Amazon, along with Adept […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: YC alum Fluently’s AI-powered English coach attracts $2M seed round
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description:
There are plenty of resources to learn English, but not so many for near-native speakers who still want to improve their fluency. That description applies to Stan Beliaev and Yurii Rebryk, and this is what inspired them to create Fluently. Making use of AI, Fluently operates as a coach that gives users feedback and tips […]

item.title: NASA and Boeing deny Starliner crew is ‘stranded’: “We’re not in any rush to come home”
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
NASA and Boeing officials pushed back against recent reporting that the two astronauts brought to the ISS on Starliner are stranded on board. The companies said in a press conference Friday that they are using “the luxury of time” to learn as much about the capsule as possible before it returns to Earth.  The two […]

item.title: Forget the debate, the Supreme Court just declared open season on regulators
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
As the country reels from a presidential debate that left no one looking good, the Supreme Court has swooped in with what could be one of the most consequential decisions it has ever made, in the context of the tech industry. By reversing a 40-year-old decision, the court has opened up regulators to endless interference […]

item.title: Android’s upcoming ‘Collections’ feature will drive users back to their apps
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
As Google described during the I/O session, the new on-device surface would organize what's most relevant to users, inviting them to jump back into their apps.

item.title: Kleiner Perkins announces $2 billion in fresh capital, showing that established firms can still raise large sums
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Many VC firms are struggling to attract new capital from their own backers amid a tepid IPO environment. But established, brand-name firms are still able to raise large funds. On Friday, Kleiner Perkins announced that it closed on more than $2 billion in fresh capital across two funds, a slight increase from the 52-year-old firm’s […]

item.title: DEI? More like ‘common decency’ — and Silicon Valley is saying ‘no thanks’
item.dc:creator: Haje Jan Kamps
item.description:
Welcome to Startups Weekly — Haje‘s weekly recap of everything you can’t miss from the world of startups. Sign up here to get it in your inbox every Friday. I just came off recording an episode of Equity, where I learned about the newest wave of stupidity. The tech industry’s DEI allergy has hit a […]

item.title: HubSpot says it’s investigating customer account hacks
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
The company “identified a security incident that involved bad actors targeting a limited number of HubSpot customers and attempting to gain unauthorized access to their accounts” on June 22.

item.title: Volkswagen’s Silicon Valley software hub is already stacked with Rivian talent
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec, Sean O'Kane
item.description:
VW Group’s struggling software arm Cariad has hired at least 23 of the startup’s top employees over the past several months.

item.title: All VCs say they are founder friendly; Detroit’s Ludlow Ventures takes that to another level
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description:
VCs Jonathon Triest and Brett deMarrais see their ability to read people and create longstanding relationships with founders as the primary reason their Detroit-based venture firm, Ludlow Ventures, is celebrating its 15th year in business. It sounds silly, attributing their longevity to what’s sometimes called “Midwestern nice.” But is it crazy? Maybe not. Before Ludlow, […]

item.title: Pitch Deck Teardown: MegaMod’s $1.9M seed deck
item.dc:creator: Haje Jan Kamps
item.description:
In an industry where creators are often tossed aside like yesterday's lootboxes, MegaMod swoops in with a heroic promise to put them front and center.

item.title: The White House will host a conference for social media creators
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
President Joe Biden’s administration is doubling down on its interest in the creator economy. In August, the White House will host the first-ever White House Creator Economy Conference, which will invite a group of influential social media personalities and industry professionals to discuss issues like data privacy, fair pay, AI and mental health with senior […]

item.title: Google Gemini: Everything you need to know about the new generative AI platform
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Google’s trying to make waves with Gemini, its flagship suite of generative AI models, apps and services. So what’s Google Gemini, exactly? How can you use it? And how does Gemini stack up to the competition? To make it easier to keep up with the latest Gemini developments, we’ve put together this handy guide, which […]

item.title: Who won the presidential debate: X or Threads?
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
There were definite differences between how the two platforms managed last night, with some saying X felt more alive, and others asserting that Threads proved that X is no longer necessary.

item.title: Following raft of consumer complaints, Shein and Temu face early EU scrutiny of DSA compliance
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Ultra-low-cost e-commerce giants Shein and Temu have only recently been confirmed as subject to centralized enforcement of the strictest layer of the European Union’s digital services regulation, the Digital Services Act (DSA), but on Friday the Commission announced it’s sent a bunch of requests for information (RFI) to both platforms vis-à-vis to their compliance with […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Beware the smiling robot with living skin
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Will robots ever have living, human skin? Researchers have been exploring the question and they’ve come up with some pretty unsettling results. I think it’s fair to say that no one would confuse any of today’s robots, no matter how advanced, with another human being. Even when a company like Tesla or Figure creates a […]

item.title: Cold shipping might be the next industry that batteries disrupt
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
Artyc has raised $14 million to date and has a product on the market, Medstow Micro, that helps ship temperature-sensitive specimens.

item.title: Remote access giant TeamViewer says Russian spies hacked its corporate network
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
The remote access giant linked the cyberattack to government-backed hackers working for Russian intelligence, known as APT29.
